channel.title: Root of Pi
channel.description: Recent content on Root of Pi

item.title: Turn the Ship Around!
item.description: L. David Marquet Hard to relate to at first, but overlal some really good insights into empowering people and turning followers into leaders. I really liked how each chapter ends with a section on questions to consider following the topic or theme of the chapter. There is definitely a lot of things that a lot of people can learn from this book! Also checkout videos of talk David has presented, and there a some really good animation/voice over summaries of the book too.
item.content:
L. David Marquet

Hard to relate to at first, but overlal some really good insights into empowering people and turning followers into leaders. I really liked how each chapter ends with a section on questions to consider following the topic or theme of the chapter. There is definitely a lot of things that a lot of people can learn from this book!

Also checkout videos of talk David has presented, and there a some really good animation/voice over summaries of the book too.

item.title: Shoe Dog
item.description: Phil Knight A memoir by the creator of Nike. Quite a complelling recollection of where it all began for Nike - trials and tribulations included. True story, while the weather was good and I was sat outside reading the book in various places around the city three different people stopped to say they’d read the book and really enjoyed it! Official Publisher Page
item.content:
Phil Knight

A memoir by the creator of Nike.

Quite a complelling recollection of where it all began for Nike - trials and tribulations included.

True story, while the weather was good and I was sat outside reading the book in various places around the city three different people stopped to say they’d read the book and really enjoyed it!

Official Publisher Page

item.title: Funny you should ask...
item.description: Your questions answered by the QI elves A good mix of quirky, interesting and funny facts and theories! Inspired by The Why Workshop on BBC Radio 2
item.content:
Your questions answered by the QI elves

A good mix of quirky, interesting and funny facts and theories!

Inspired by The Why Workshop on BBC Radio 2

item.title: Kafka On The Shore
item.description: Haruki Murakami A trippy one, which I guess you could in part classify as sci-fi. There were uncomfortable parts, but something hypnotic about the time travel, eery coincidences, and profecies that saved it for me. Interestingly alternating chapters read through two distinct but later (as the book progresses) interrelated plots. Why should you read “Kafka on the Shore”? - Iseult Gillespie
item.content:
Haruki Murakami

A trippy one, which I guess you could in part classify as sci-fi. There were uncomfortable parts, but something hypnotic about the time travel, eery coincidences, and profecies that saved it for me. Interestingly alternating chapters read through two distinct but later (as the book progresses) interrelated plots.

Why should you read “Kafka on the Shore”? - Iseult Gillespie

item.title: Noise Damage, My life as a rock and roll underdog
item.description: James Kennedy Best book I’ve picked up in a while! Insightful and enlightening, adding some humour to the dark realities of the music scene. Easy to read, hard to put down. Buy the book
item.content:
James Kennedy

Best book I’ve picked up in a while! Insightful and enlightening, adding some humour to the dark realities of the music scene. Easy to read, hard to put down.

Buy the book

item.title: Dark Matter
item.description: Blake Crouch The first fiction book I’ve ready in a while, and a grippingly surreal one at that. Moving through a multiverse of alternate realities there are plenty of opportunities to describe so many different scenes, so vividly.
item.content:
Blake Crouch

The first fiction book I’ve ready in a while, and a grippingly surreal one at that. Moving through a multiverse of alternate realities there are plenty of opportunities to describe so many different scenes, so vividly.

item.title: 147 Things
item.description: Jim Chapman And interestingly smart and funny way to learn 147(ish) things with facts and experiences covering just about everything. 147 Things - Jim Chapman (good reads review)

item.title: How the World Thinks, A Global History of Philosophy
item.description: Julian Baggini
item.content: Julian Baggini

item.title: Measure What Matters
item.description: John Doerr An interesting follow up to Andy Groves “High Output Management”; guiding the reader to data driven success with a number of additional pearls of wisdom, even with bonus resources at the back of the book. Build an environment that emphasises output, but beware the activity trap - the belief that output = productivity, and therefore increasing activity’s, which doesn’t necessarily produce value. Andy Groves teaching OKRs at Intel
item.content:
John Doerr

An interesting follow up to Andy Groves “High Output Management”; guiding the reader to data driven success with a number of additional pearls of wisdom, even with bonus resources at the back of the book.

Build an environment that emphasises output, but beware the activity trap - the belief that output = productivity, and therefore increasing activity’s, which doesn’t necessarily produce value.

Andy Groves teaching OKRs at Intel

item.title: How to win your pub quiz!
item.description: Les Palmer A whitty collection of advice and insights to help you understand and (hopefully) win your pub quiz!
item.content:
Les Palmer

A whitty collection of advice and insights to help you understand and (hopefully) win your pub quiz!

item.title: High Output Management
item.description: Andy Groves Possibly the most easily read management book I’ve read so far. With focus on process, measurement, leading teams and making great decisions.
item.content:
Andy Groves

Possibly the most easily read management book I’ve read so far. With focus on process, measurement, leading teams and making great decisions.

item.title: Man Vs Big Data
item.description: Stewart Cowley Every day data explained. It’ll make you happy, sad, proud, paranoid but most of all curious. A range of interesting and relateable topics for everyone. The more we understand, the more we can control and improve in our lives. An interview with Stewart Cowley
item.content:
Stewart Cowley

Every day data explained. It’ll make you happy, sad, proud, paranoid but most of all curious. A range of interesting and relateable topics for everyone. The more we understand, the more we can control and improve in our lives.

An interview with Stewart Cowley

item.title: Micro-serfs
item.description: Douglas Coupland An interesting change of topic, an epistolary novel (of literary work, in the form of letters). Commical, at times confusing but strangely relatable. Douglas Coupland
item.content:
Douglas Coupland

An interesting change of topic, an epistolary novel (of literary work, in the form of letters). Commical, at times confusing but strangely relatable.

Douglas Coupland

item.title: Be More Pirate (Or How To Take On The World And Win)
item.description: Sam Conniff From rogues to role models: Be More Pirate reveals the radical strategies of Golden Age pirates, and updates them into clear solutions for making your mark on the 21st Century. Be More Pirate draws parallels between the strategy and innovation of legends like Henry Morgan with modern day rebels, like Elon Musk, Malala and Blockchain, and reveals how to apply their tactics to life and work today.
item.content:
Sam Conniff

From rogues to role models: Be More Pirate reveals the radical strategies of Golden Age pirates, and updates them into clear solutions for making your mark on the 21st Century. Be More Pirate draws parallels between the strategy and innovation of legends like Henry Morgan with modern day rebels, like Elon Musk, Malala and Blockchain, and reveals how to apply their tactics to life and work today.

Be More Pirate

item.title: Cat's Cradle
item.description: Kurt Vonnegut A satirical novel about politics, religion, and the end of the world. A fascinating account of a character by the name of Felix Hoenikker, father of the modern day atomic bomb. Dr. H however was actually based on a certain Doctor Irving Langmuir, who left a much less ruinous legacy. Biography of KV
item.content:
Kurt Vonnegut

A satirical novel about politics, religion, and the end of the world. A fascinating account of a character by the name of Felix Hoenikker, father of the modern day atomic bomb. Dr. H however was actually based on a certain Doctor Irving Langmuir, who left a much less ruinous legacy.

Biography of KV

item.title: Strength Finder 2.0
item.description: Tom Rath An interesting charity shop pickup. Not the actual ‘Strength Finder 2.0’ assessment, but the themes and ideas for actions to apply your strengths discover strengths and develop natural talents. This doubled up as a very insightful read about many different talent and personality types/traits and how to action them or work with others who possess them. About the book
item.content:
Tom Rath

An interesting charity shop pickup.

Not the actual ‘Strength Finder 2.0’ assessment, but the themes and ideas for actions to apply your strengths discover strengths and develop natural talents. This doubled up as a very insightful read about many different talent and personality types/traits and how to action them or work with others who possess them.

About the book

item.title: The Dark Net
item.description: Jamie Bartlett Intellectually stimulating but harrowing insights to the outer limits of the internet, all closer than we realise. Reflecting on digital anonymity, freedom, psychology, online subcultures, mesmerising feats of programming and more. About the book
item.content:
